external.description: Alt: Popping into $psScriptRoot is great when you want to reference multiple local paths.  Knowing how to use $psScriptRoot is required to reliably build scripts that reference a local path.
external.title: a knight with a helmet and a sword says " this is the way "

record.text:
ðŸ’¯

This is the way to correctly handle relative paths in a script or function.

If you're going to be doing it often, I'd suggest throwing these two lines at the top/bottom of your script:

~~~PowerShell
if ($psScriptRoot) { Push-Location $psScriptRoot }
#...
if ($psScriptRoot) { Pop-Location } 
~~~
